project.teaser: LOESS will map, connect and engage with multiple actors in Communities of Practice (CoPs) to provide an overview of the current level of soil related knowledge in different educational levels and develop teaching programmes and materials including an Atlas of Soil Education...
project.objective: LOESS will map, connect and engage with multiple actors in Communities of Practice (CoPs) to provide an overview of the current level of soil related knowledge in different educational levels and develop teaching programmes and materials including an Atlas of Soil Education. LOESS will explore educational needs amongst school pupils (primary and secondary levels), students (tertiary level) and young professionals, and society across the European Union and Horizon Europe Associated Countries. LOESS will investigate why existing material is not used to a greater extent and co-create courses and modules for soil education, including virtual reality/augmented reality applications. These resources will target the different stages of education and connect to global and local challenges of climate change and biodiversity loss and the Sustainable Development Goals. LOESS will co-create and test pedagogical techniques to encourage effective knowledge flows and discourse between educators and learners and between different knowledge systems (scientific, political, individual local and collective cultural knowledge). It will carry out activities in 15 countries and provide hands-on activities related to soil education through Community Engaged Research and Learning. To overcome the awareness gap, LOESS will organise focused campaigns and events to exchange knowledge, promote discussion on the results and encourage higher uptake. LOESS will also engage with public authorities and institutions responsible for primary, secondary and tertiary education and provide targeted recommendations and resources for improved knowledge enhancement. Capacity building, knowledge exchange and peer-to-peer learning will accompany LOESS' education and dissemination activities.
project.title: Literacy boost through an Operational Educational Ecosystem of Societal actors on Soil health
project.keywords: Soil, Campaigning, Science Shops, peer-to-peer learning, SDGs

result.title: Report on awareness, needs and vision for soil education
result.description: The deliverable will describe content deficits, educational needs, practical barriers and enabling factors. The thematic analysis of and reflection on focus groups, interviews and survey data will provide shared relational experiences and common factors in innovative soil teaching. Points of contention and disagreement between different CoP actors (e.g., between lecturers and students) from the workshops will be also included as well as findings from sister projects and comparisons across existing data sources.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - LOESS (Literacy boost through an Operational Educational Ecosystem of Societal actors on Soil health)
result.teaser: Soils’ ecosystem services need to be protected and preserved for future generations. To achieve the goals and objectives of the EU Soil Strategy and the Mission Soil a comprehensive involvement of actors across Europe is required. To value soils, people need more than...

category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Interim Report on Dissemination, Exploitation and Cross-Networking
result.description: A first report on LOESS' proactive cross-network collaboration with Soil, Biodiversity and Climate Action Initiatives and Strategy panels, Regional/ National Ministries, and other projects connected to the European Commissions Soil Mission and its Lighthouses

result.title: Dissemination and Exploitation plan
result.description: The dissemination and exploitation plan will pay special attention to the outreach and engagement of academic and non-academic stakeholders in formal and non-formal learning environments. The plan aims at supporting the WP4 campaigns and reach out to specific groups and audiences. The plan will also address the exploitation and sustainability aspects, ensuring timely promotion of projects results and outputs and engagement of parties outside the consortium, interested to use or adopt them.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
